Literature Review: Statistical data privacy (SDP) has emerged as a crucial field of research, aiming to balance the increasing demand for open data sharing with concerns about sensitive information disclosure. This review provides an overview of the statistical foundations common to both statistical disclosure control (SDC) and differential privacy (DP), highlighting major developments in SDP and presenting open research problems in private inference. The trade-offs between data release mechanisms and disclosure risk measures are a central theme in SDP, with both SDC and DP frameworks sharing the same statistical problems at their core. In this review, we will discuss the statistical foundations of SDC and DP, major developments in SDP, and exciting open research problems in private inference.
